channel.title: Modeling Thread
channel.description:
Ok, well, in a few weeks I plan to create my first interior. After working with interior for a couple of months, I plan to start moving on to cars and single item, high-poly modeling. However, I wont be able to get there if I don't practice practice practice.
In this thread I'll post my models, as well as ask people to request models. Nothing too complicated though, for the moment. If I can't do it I'll say.
Seeing as I'm planning to do interiors in a few weeks/months time, I'll ask first for you to request household objects. You can choose the textures, colours, and so on. Just note them down. (I'm pretty poor at C4D. If anyone has SomethingToHides msn, can you PM it to me.) :)
Coffee table: [IMG]http://i14.tinypic.com/52bkdu0.jpg[/img]
Chest of draws: [IMG]http://i17.tinypic.com/5zgg4ux.jpg[/img]
Glass/Metal chair: [IMG]http://i12.tinypic.com/625dn3s.jpg[/img]

item.title: Modeling Thread
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Well… the wood doesn’t look very good so try nice modern colours. How about a white rectanglular table with a glass middle and chrome/metal corners. I know you have already done a coffee table but this would be just a normal table.

item.title: Modeling Thread
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

I will, and I thank you for the advice.

FastBawlz, bed time for me, it’ll be done tomorrow.

Keeeeep requestin’ <3[br][size=1]Posted on: 04-06-2007, 20:59:43[/size][hr]Ok, not in the modeling mood today. I’ll play a bit of CS:S and see how I feel

In the mean time - Household objects please. I’ll be starting my first interior this week

Read full topic

item.title: Modeling Thread
item.dc:creator: @hodunken hodunken
item.description:
@hodunken wrote:

[quote=“Mr.Chris, post:17, topic:105897”][quote author=hodunken link=topic=151680.msg1433559#msg1433559 date=1181011652]
hey mr.chris.
glad to see that people are starting to get into modeling…

I started with furniture models as well…

one thing that stood out to me, on the first model (coffee table) you had to grain of the wood going along the y-axis. you may like it that way but you might be able to clean it up a bit if you make the grain following the length of the table(x-axis). its just the little details that can make a simple model standout more.

keep’em comming
[/quote]

You rip your models though? :/[br][size=1]Posted on: 04-06-2007, 20:48:43[/size][hr][quote author=FastBawlz link=topic=151680.msg1433544#msg1433544 date=1181011314]
Make me a iPod with the Headphones… :
[/quote]

Will do. It ought to be much, much better than that stupid tutorial that’s on a lot of tutorial sites[/quote]

do I?
I have proved myself… no need to doubt anymore…
I was simply trying to help. regardless if you think im a ripper or not, you might want to try what I suggested.

Read full topic
